summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Detention Center, transmitting discovery materials for inmate Ghislaine Maxwell and requesting she be allowed access to them.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the correspondence, an inmate at the Metropolitan Detention Center for whom discovery materials are being provided.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The signatory of the letter, transmitting discovery materials on behalf of the U.S. Attorney's Office.

connections.description: Strauss, as an Assistant U.S. Attorney, is part of the prosecution team handling the case against defendant Maxwell, as evidenced by transmitting discovery to her.

events.title: Transmission of Discovery to Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends discovery materials pertaining to the case against Ghislaine Maxwell to the detention center where she is held.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Metropolitan Detention Center, 80 29th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: The document is a formal correspondence from the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
It confirms Ghislaine Maxwell was an inmate at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn as of November 2020.
The prosecution, represented by Audrey Strauss, was providing discovery materials to the defense as part of the legal process.
The document is dated November 18, 2020, during the pre-trial phase of Maxwell's prosecution.
